MyHand
GITEICaptoglove.​Module
public
GITEICaptoglove.​MyHand

Handles Captoglove module configured as hand sensor.

Author
Laura Moreno

laamo[xxx]renoro@unal.[xxx]edu.co

Copyrigth

Copyrigth 2020 Universidad Nacional de Colombia, all rigths reserved.

Types
HandType
public enum HandType

List of possible ways to use Captoglove module with this class:

TYPE_RIGHT_HAND

As right hand sensor

TYPE_LEFT_HAND

As left hand sensor

Functions
MyHand
public MyHand(
int nID,
HandType eType
)

Initializes variables for Captoglove module configuration.

Parameters
nID
int

Captoglove ID (4 digits number)

etype
HandType

Captoglove use mode

Example
MyHand RightHand = new MyHand(2496, MyHand.HandType.TYPE_RIGHT_HAND);
SetHandType
private void SetHandType(
HandType eType
)

Saves Captoglove module use mode.

Parameters
eType
HandType

Captoglove module use mode

Example
SetHandType(MyHand.HandType.TYPE_RIGHT_HAND);
GetHandtype
public HandType GetHandtype()
Returns

Captoglove module use mode

SetFingerEquationReady
private void SetFingerEquationReady(
bool b
)

Saves whether the algorithm for finger movement has been created or not.

Parameters
b
bool

true or false

Example
SetFingerEquationReady(true);
Notes

Normally used after SetFingerEquation() function is completed.

GetFingerEquationReady
private bool GetFingerEquationReady()
Returns
true

Finger algorithm has been created

false

Finger algorithm has NOT been created

SetOmittedDegrees
private void SetOmittedDegrees(
int nDegrees
)

Saves the number of degrees that must be omitted in the rotation of the fingers to avoid shaking.

Parameters
nDegrees
int

Number of degrees that must be omitted in the rotation of the fingers

Example
SetOmittedDegrees(2);
Notes

Usually small values between 0 and 5 to keep fast response in simulation.

GetOmittedDegrees
public int GetOmittedDegrees()
Returns

Number of degrees that are omitted in the movement of the fingers

SetHandObject
public int SetHandObject(
Transform tHandObj
)

Attaches Captoglove module movement to hand object.

Parameters
tHandObj
Transform

Hand object

Returns
0

Success

-1

Object error

Example
SetHandObject(transRH);
Notes

Place the hand object horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function to save default position.

SetFingerObject
public int SetFingerObject(
Transform tThumbObj,
Transform tIndexObj,
Transform tMiddleObj,
Transform tRingObj,
Transform tPinkyObj
)

Attaches Captoglove sensor movement to finger object.

Parameters
tThumbObj
Transform

Thumb finger object

tIndexObj
Transform

Index finger object

tMiddleObj
Transform

Middle finger object

tRingObj
Transform

Ring finger object

tPinkyObj
Transform

Pinky finger object

Returns
0

Success

-1

Finger object error

-2

Child object error

Example
SetFingerObject(transThuR,transIndR,transMidR,transRinR, transPinR);
Notes

This function expects each finger object to have at least 2 children to simulate phalanges movement.  Place the finger object horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function to save default position.

SetFingerSensor
private int SetFingerSensor(
int nThumbSensor,
int nIndexSensor,
int nMiddleSensor,
int nRingSensor,
int nPinkySensor,
int nPressureSensor
)

Saves the sensor ID connected in Captoglove module to each finger.

Parameters
nThumbSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for thumb finger

nIndexSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for index finger

nMiddleSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for middle finger

nRingSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for ring finger

nPinkySensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for pinky finger

nPressureSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for pressure sensor

Example
SetFingerSensor(1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 2);
Returns
0

Success

-1

Error: Sensor ID error

Notes

Sensor ID can be verified in Captoglove documentation. Usually a number between 1 and 10.

SetDefaultRotLimits
private void SetDefaultRotLimits()

Set the limits for the rotation of the hand object and each finger object.

Notes

The values configured in this function are valid only for the hand 3D model provided with this library.

SetPitchLimits
private void SetPitchLimits(
float fMaxUpRotation,
float fMaxDownRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for pitch rotation of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxUpRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing upward in the pitch movement

fMaxDownRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing downward in the pitch movement

Example
SetPitchLimits(90, -90);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for hand object.

SetYawLimits
private void SetYawLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for yaw rotation of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing to the right in the yaw movement

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing to the left in the yaw movement

Example
SetYawLimits(90, -90);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for hand object.

SetRollLimits
private void SetRollLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for roll rotation of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is face up after turning it to the right.

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is face up after turning it to the left.

Example
SetRollLimits(90, -90);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for hand object.

SetThumbRotLimits
private void SetThumbRotLimits(
float fMinRotation,
float fMaxRotation,
float fMinRotation1,
float fMaxRotation1,
float fMinRotation2,
float fMaxRotation2
)

Saves the rotation limits for the thumb finger object.

Parameters
fMinRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the thumb finger is fully extended

fMaxRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the thumb finger is fully bent

fMinRotation1
float

Angle of rotation where the first child is fully extended

fMaxRotation1
float

Angle of rotation where the first child is fully bent

fMinRotation2
float

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully extended

fMaxRotation2
float

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully bent

Example
SetThumbRotLimits(-9.475f, -60, -6.888f, -50, -6.334f, -50);
Notes

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for finger object.

float fMinRotation,
float fMaxRotation,

float fMaxRotation1,

float

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully extended

Example

Values must be set as they are read in Unity Inspector panel for finger object.

MoveHand
public void MoveHand()

Updates hand object rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() function of Unity script.

MoveHandNoYaw
public void MoveHandNoYaw()

Updates hand object rotation according with Captoglove module movement. Yaw movement is ommited.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() function of Unity script.  Normally used when arm simulation is also running so the yaw movement is done by the arm.

SetHandAngle
private void SetHandAngle(
bool bYaw
)

Calculates hand object rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Parameters
bYaw
bool

true or false to simulate yaw movement

Angle2Axes
private void Angle2Axes(
float fPitchA,
float fYawA,
float fRollA
)

Set rotation angle to each axis of the hand object.

Parameters
fPitchA
float

Angle of pitch rotation

fYawA
float

Angle of yaw rotation

fRollA
float

Angle of roll rotation

MoveFingers
public void MoveFingers()

Updates each finger object rotation according with Captoglove sensor value.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() function of Unity script to simulate fingers movement.

SetFingersAngle
private void SetFingersAngle()

Calculates each finger object rotation according with Captoglove sensor value.

SetFingerEquation
private void SetFingerEquation()

Creates algorithm for finger movement according with sensor calibration.

GetHandPosition
public Vector3 GetHandPosition()
Returns

Global position of hand object

GetHandRotation
public Vector3 GetHandRotation()
Returns

Global euler angles of hand object

GetThumbPosition
public Vector3 GetThumbPosition()
Returns

Global position of thumb finger object

GetIndexPosition
public Vector3 GetIndexPosition()
Returns

Global position of index finger object

GetMiddlePosition
public Vector3 GetMiddlePosition()
Returns

Global position of middle finger object

GetRingPosition
public Vector3 GetRingPosition()
Returns

Global position of ring finger object

GetPinkyPosition
public Vector3 GetPinkyPosition()
Returns

Global position of pinky finger object

SensorPressed
public bool SensorPressed()
Returns
true

Pressure sensor is being pressed

false

Pressure sensor is released

HandClosed
public bool HandClosed()
Returns
true

All fingers are bent more than 50%

false

All fingers are extended or bent less than 50%

FingerGesture1
public bool FingerGesture1()
Returns
true

Index finger is extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

FingerGesture2
public bool FingerGesture2()
Returns
true

Index and middle finger are extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

FingerGesture3
public bool FingerGesture3()
Returns
true

Index, middle and ring finger are extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

SaveHandInFile
public void SaveHandInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves module data in file with following format: x hand rotation; y hand rotation; z hand rotation [quaternions]

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveHandInFile("RightHandMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() of Unity script to save data continuously

SaveFingerInFile
public void SaveFingerInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves sensor data in file with following format: thumb finger; index finger; middle finger; ring finger; pinky finger; pressure sensor [conductivity S/m]

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveFingerInFile("RightFingerMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() of your app to save data continuously
